reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm torn when it comes to reviewing this game.  I loved the first 15 hours of gameplay.  The problem is that in that 15 hours you can pretty much complete EVERYTHING the game offers.  You can go from wielding a wooden stick, to the best weapon/gear in the game with relative easy.  That wouldn't normally be an issue, if there was some reason to get those great items.  But there isn't.  There are no world bosses to prepare for... no dungeons to get stronger for... no Elite monsters to defend for.

The enemy variety is terrible.  Each biome may have 1 or 2 unique enemies... but most of the enemies are just recolored skins of enemies from other biomes.  You WANT to explore the absolutely huge world, but feel like it would be a waste because, with the exception of some cool randomly generated terrains, there is nothing new or exciting around the corner.  You can travel to the other side of the world, and the caves and mining nodes are the exact same as the ones in the biomes near your base.  There is simply no reason to venture off.

Now, for the building aspect of this game... it's great.  If you want to come in, and just build huge structures and houses or whatever... you have all the tools to do so.  It's fun, and there is a decent variety of materials.

The UI is reasonable, and you don't feel like it holds you back.  The one area of absolute insanity on the part of the developers is the teleporters.  You can place beacons" around the world that you can teleport to.  Now
date: a normal person would think that in order to teleport to a location
hoursPlayed: select the location you want to teleport to
voteText: then POOF!  But nope
helpfulPercent: not this game.  Here
votesHelpful: you have to place the teleporter
votesTotal: and then give it a code name which you create out of building materials.  Any time you want to teleport to that location
votesFunny: you have to input the building materials which you code named the teleporter.  Sound confusing?  It is.\n\nWhy is that a problem?  Because the game doesn't keep track of ANY of this for you.  You can have 20 teleporters across the world
commentsCount: and you are expected to remember the unique code combinations for all of them.  You know what that means?  I have about 17 teleporters out in the world that I will never visit again because I can't remember the code combination.  In order to make any of this function
column16:
you would need to keep a real life pen and paper list of all of your teleporters and codes.  That is such an overly complicated system.

This game has been in "Early Access" for two years now.  It boggles my mind that the game was playable two years ago... and yet still only has the current level of depth to it.  You would think there would be more to do in the game if it has been in production for 3+ years.

TL;DR  - Fun for the first 15 hours or so.  Then it's just a build-a-block game offering no progression for your character."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Creativerse, going into the game I assumed it was going to be a terrible Minecraft clone, like so many others. I was wrong. Creativerse might take place in a world made of cubes, but the graphics, gameplay, and overall feel of the game is very different. From a graphical standpoint Creativerse uses higher res textures than the pixel look of Minecraft, and even includes monsters, characters, and items that are entirely a different style from the cube based world, including the playable characters. All of the worlds in Creativerse are multiplayer. You can join and be joined by friends and strangers depending on the world and settings.

Creativerse feels like a sandbox game that builds of of concepts other sandbox games has, but still manages to feel all its own. I recommend it to anyone looking for a free to play sandbox game to try. Creativerse is free on Steam now so feel free to jump in and explore, play and do whatever in Createverse.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a first for me doing a review, well this is going to be more of a first impressions during the first 24 hrs of game play.
First the visuals are very pleasing graphics are nice and well done and so far i haven't seen any re-colouring to create different areas.
Game play is nice and fluid some of the creature movement can be a little buggy but nothing game breaking but its early days.
The crafting system is very well done i like the progression craft to learn new upgraded items and also the chance that recipes can drop from chests and mob loot.
Building is very much like other games of the same genre.
The mobs are well done with a great art style some cute some goofy looking and then there are the menacing ones.
So far i have found the world to be rather large and haven't found an end to it as yet, having vines hanging from trees that you can climb is a nice touch and being able to tree hop is different, digging down  is a fun task and I`ve found can take some time as you need to upgrade your mining glove to be able to dig deeper and i got to the cursed layer late last night.
Environment effects i had mixed feelings about this but they add another element and sometimes a sense of urgency to get the hell out quickly, as i said being on the cursed layer i had a  cursed and a heat debuff ticking away( and yes there are potions you can craft to to keep these at bay).
Over all the game is very pleasing and a lot of fun to play i am looking forward to what will be next and I`m very impressed with what they have done so far.
Devs listen and are also very active in the forums from what i have seen, there has been talk about Creativerse going F2P many don't like the idea but there a many that also welcome it, i purchased this on sale i paid i think $13 but would happily pay $20 .
I hope to add more to this as time goes on and I would suggest to grab it while its on sale  as there is a whole lot of fun to be had .

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI don't for a second regret purchasing this game now despite the fact it's going to be F2P once it is fully released. I'm glad to say I helped even a small amount in getting this game developed. With it being early access, sure there is some bugs and other issues. But I expected them before I even started playing. None of them have ever been game breaking. But what's great is the amount of things this game does right from a very early stage in its development. There is a high level of promise here and I hope the devs stick behind this game and turn it into something fantastic.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For some reason I find Minecraft boring despite my kids loving it.  Somehow this game has spoken to me and it's turned out to be great family fun at our house.  We purchased 2 copies for the kids and one for myself and the wife.  It may not be the most amazing game ever but it's a lot of fun being able to build things and explore in a simple but yet complex dynamic environment.  The graphics are good in the sense that it's a step up from Minecraft, though performance seems to be a bit laggy at times for unknown reasons (not bad enough to completely impact gameplay).

Overall, if you're tired of the same old Minecraft, give Creativerse a try.

Allow me to sum up this game and what i think of it in a paragraph (or 2)

As most people would notice, this is another game based off of minecraft. And while this is true, that does not mean you should not try it. The way I see it, Creativerse achieved the thing another game known as Block Story failed to accomplish: minecraft with RPG elements. The textures in this game are incredible along with the creatures and how crafting works. All in all, I would say its at least worth a quick look to see if you like the game's style.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAlthough this game may seem very similar to the popular game Minecraft" there are very many differences that need to be taken into account. I just started playing Creativerse and have been almost instantaniously gripped to it. It's an awesome game to play with friends. Seeing as Creativerse is still in "Early Access" I am looking forward to what the creators have in stock for the players. There is always something that draws you and makes you want to keep playing. The feeling of killing a monster you haven't encountered before and seeing what it drops is one that I don't really see in other games. This game is unique and is highly commendable. It deserves to start off with a bang. I honestly am very excited and have great anticipation for the future of Creativerse. I strongly recommend getting it. Props to the creators. I will leave the rest for you as the reader to figure out yourself whether this is the game for you or not. Personally
recommended: it is the game for me."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Excellent game... and is truly free!  There are a few microtransactions but they are just simple cosmetic blocks and some blueprints for people that are not really interested in creating builds themselves(which does not make a lot of sense considering that at least half the game is about building).

As an avid sandbox fan, including years spent playing that other big block building game and many other sandbox/simulation games, I have waded through the trash pile of clones and wannabes for a long time, hoping to find viable alternatives... I found that with Creativerse!

This game is different enough to make it stand out.  The graphics are superb, gameplay is smooth, mechanics are intuitive, crafting is simple and progression based.  You can make progression easy on yourself by making use of many mechanics for easier mob killing, or skip all of that and dive in with nothing but the clothes on your back and a wooden stick for protection.

The pet taming system is great and the animations are cute and smooth... well done!

Playing with your friends is super easy and quick to set up.

The only negatives are the little early access bugs that sometimes annoy but nothing is game breaking or outside of acceptable EA norms... I have experienced many more frustrating bugs with finished games than are present in this already very polished game.

I would love to see more mobs, machines and blocks of course, but no matter how many they implement, I am sure everyone will always welcome more of those things.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I recommend this game insofar as the price is right - free.  The visuals are pretty darn good for a voxel, minecraft type world.   In terms of gameplay this starts off rather fun and interesting.  A lot of biomes to explore and find.  Building is intuitive for the most part.  The block rotation took a while to figure out and the method of spinning the blocks around is actually maddening.  If they had made it so holding down R locks your hud and only spun the block instead of your character as well, this would've been a lot easier.  Beyond that, the game sorta falls flat after a few weeks because of limited building capabilities.  One you get to the lowest levels of the map (corruption) and farm up a bunch of those materials and collect all the animals and things you want, there isn't much else to do but build.  And that can be gratifying for a while.  i enjoyed building little farms, collecting a bunch of animals and plant from different biomes, making a refillable refridgerator and lava producer, mob spawners and what not.  Bult some cool buildings and a boat and a bunch of other stuff, but after a while you hit a wall.  The types of blocks are not even filled out - for example you can make chairs and tables with wood - stone - obsidian - iron - diamond - lumite - the full material progression.  But then something like barred windows only goes up to stone.... Sorta weird.  Other things are like being able to make lumite walls but no stairs, roofs, or floors.  So, making high end buildings that are unified in theme is basically impossible at this point.   In addition, while this does have animal taming, block rotating, and a few other mechanics mine craft doesn't, it is dwarfed by minecraft's other content - There are no AI peeps, there is nothing like switches or rail tracks, etc. to give this game a lot of high end, end-game content to keep you building for years like the minecraft folks have.  There are no end-game boss mods other than this one Rockzilla thing you can spawn in.  And unlike in other games, your tamed mobs become basically farm animals.  Nothing fights for you.  No mounts.  They kinda just sit around.

Anyway, fun to take for a spin, particularly if you never got into minecraft and this is your first foray into something like this.  If it weren't free, I woulda probably said it was a waste of time and money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Solid voxel game that manages to be unique while still offering what you come to expect from Minecraft clones. Oh yea, the mining" animation is pretty neat.

Pros
- Good textures
- Interesting creature design
- Solid performance
- Lots of stuff to discover and craft

Cons
- It's a voxel game. This is less of a con and more of a "some people will hate it just for being voxel""

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I downloaded this game thinking it would most likely be mediocre to bad. I have played minecraft a little and thought to give this game a shot.

It's great! Especially for a free game. The whole world, mechanics, music, crafting... it's all done so much better than minecraft. I feel peaceful when I play. The instructions are clear as to what you need to do in order to build xyz.

The physics is nice as well. It has that sort of.. floaty unreal/quake feel. I even tried strafe jumping and it almost worked haha.

If someone is looking for a cute game (that is also safe for kids) to pass the time and relieve stress, I would recommend this!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is amazing.  At first, I thought it was just a generic mix of Minecraft and Terarria, or possibley a rip-off of Trove or Cube World, but it was something new.  The game starts you off holding your hand, but then drops you off, letting you do whatever you want-  that is untill you realize that the game's combat system sucks.  Combat from the begining to the end  consists of you and the enemy wailing on eachother untill somebody falls over.  You are expected to be physicly stronger than your enemy, not smarter.  You can't even avoid and attack once you initiate combat; the enemy's attacks just go on a timer.  It woulden't be such a big problem if combat was not such a big part of the game, but it is.  That is the number one issue with this game that games like Cube World and Terarria or even Minecraft do much better.  Also, the first few days, all enemys reck house and you have NO chance of killing them.  Apart from that, the building, exploring, and FANTASTIC multiplayer system works very well, with random treasure chests and a large ammount of areas to explore.  They nailed the underground caves and different mining system, as well as crafting, which is on a timer. The game also looks great for an early access and free game being on steam for only a few days.  I give this game a 8/10 for the faulty combat, and I hope they fix this issue in the future.

Early Access Review

So I found this game and...

It's like minecraft and trove together, in a good way. So after a few hours of gameplay I can state the followings:
1. The game is under development, and it needs patches here and there.
2. The controlls in the game are simple, the movements and actions are smooth, the PvE combat is acceptable.
3. I love the idea behind the game: every map is a multiplayer server too (as long as it works its awesome!)
4. Truly free gameplay money is only for supporting (at least now)
5. Is an enjoyable game so far

So if you've read this far, and you like Minecraft and/or any similar game you should give this a try too! But don't take is as the full experience and please look back when the game is finished!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis reviews comes from someone who has only dabbled with minecraft for less than 30 hours. I can see the appeal of minecraft and enjoy other builders work such as you tubers like Sl1pg8r, I can see why people are still drawn to that game for the sake that it is the orginal Voxel builder. It does however have limititation and isn't perfect and this game is by no means a rip off minecraft it takes some of the best ideas from minecraft and adds its own. I couldn't get into minecraft due to it being a little tedious in losing equipment and having to find your own way around to your house and such. The crafting was also a touch lazy as you had to find out for yourself how to craft things, this may be part of the fun in minecraft and this game may seem linear at first but for the brief couple hours i have played I can see the advantage of the system of unlocking recipes. It guides the player through it all and when they are the knowledge it allows the player to become creative without the  fidn out for yourself learning curve which minecraft leads you down. Also the graphics major plus I had to combine 2 texture packs in minecrafts to make it look how I wanted this involved me selecing block by block from them both which took some time. I liek the fact that the mobs are more challenging and that adds to this game. I enjoy watching people who can build in minecraft but I can see myself actually enjoy playing this game. As far as the business model I feel at present that have it right, minecraft has yet to go free even after all the years of play and I have played other free to play games namely planetside 2, league of legends and dota 2 so I understand transactions are needed. I feel the transactions at present don't take away any fun from the game you still get access to the basic blocks and all the game, people who want to pay can buy pre made designs or more decorative blocks I feel this is just a bonus for the more creative people and doens't destroy the game for people who don't want to buy anything.  Hope this helps people out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't knock this off as some clone. Oh, no, Creativerse is something grand in the making.

It feels as though the creators of Minecraft listened to every whispered complaint and then, BAM, Creativerse was born. It's (almost) everything you loved about Minecraft with better grapghics, and a more laidback, sci-fi atmosphere.

Creativerse gives you:
-Bigger pet selection (every monster is tameable)
-Pets pay out (you get items for caring for these buggers)
-Better water graphics (Physics? Not so much...)
-Adorable pre-teen characters (though I wish you could change their appearance. Oh well, maybe in an update.)
-No Creepers! (huge plus for me. No random, hard-work-destroying explosions)
-Sci-fi atmosphere (Suck-arms instead of pickaxes and glowy machinery for crafting)
-Teleportation (makes life easy. You can recall to wherever you place your pad using the 'T' shortcut OR create a numbetr of teleporters you can step through and link together via a nifty little menu where you place items inside it to attune them to one another)
-Easy to navigate U.I. (Very intuitive. Bonus: almost all of the items you can interact with can be renamed)
-Dungeoning (Plenty of monsters and dark pits to wander through with a torch, though the equipment selection feels a little sparce thus far)
-It's now FREE TO PLAY.
-Did I mention it's free?

So, yes, it draws a lot of inspiration from Minecraft, but it's definitely not a carbon copy. Definitely worth a play. Creativerse is far from perfect, but I'm looking forward to what future updates hold.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've never played Minecraft before, but when my wife picked up this game during it's free week, I decided I would check it out as well. It is absolutely FANTASTIC. I played it for about a day and a half before I decided to pay for it, and I don't even slightly regret the choice.

It's still early access, and it occasionally shows, but this game shows an extremely high level of polish that i've not seen on some games that are even fully released. The bugs that i've come across are usually small, but pretty regularly re-creatable. However the depth and breadth of the game make them easy to overlook.

My biggest problem is with the combat, honestly. It's almost always a battle of attrition, and if you survive, you tend to end up with low health. At that point it's almost better to just kill yourself somehow and run and get your things. Dying is basically a part of the game, so it's good that there's no REAL repercussions for doing so (other than having to go pick up the things in your bag). Some creatures are absurdly difficult, and dodging is almost a complete non-factor. You can, occasionally, find a good spot to dance a circle around a creature and not get hit, but it's inconsisitent.

My 2nd largest issue is the durability of some items in the game compared to the amount of materials required to craft them. The mining cells in particular come to mind. There's one of two ways to solve this as far as I can see: Either make items with durability (like mining cells) last a lot longer, or make the odd materials to make them more readily available. I'm not saying I want my stone mining cell to last me through 18 hours of playtime, but I would like to be able to find 5 red flowers without running around for 20 minutes looking at every other tree I find.

In spite of this, the game is immensely fun, and you can easily find yourself sucked into it. Digging into your mine deeper, crafting your house to look absurdly awesome, or just exploring the surprisingly vast environments, you'll find yourself readily wondering where the hours have gone. I'd definitely give this game a 9/10, because it's technically not even finished yet. You should definitely check it out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay I haven't played this game much, so I may add more onto the review as time passes.

This is game is fantastic, I see unlimited gameplay in the future. Not only that, but they just made the game free, so there's really no reason you shouldn't at least try this game. Before I say anything else, even though this game is blocky:

THIS GAME IS NOT A RIP-OFF OF MINECRAFT

Sure, it looks similar, but many games share the same concept. That's why we have genres of games. If a survival game is blocky, that doesn't mean it copied minecraft.

Now that that's out of the way, we can move on to the true review. This game is amazing, and I could play it for several hours a day. There's always a place to explore or structure to be built. The graphics are impressive, and the animations and models are great. In detail, here are my personal pros and cons of Creativerse:

PROS:
-Great graphics and models
-Good framerate
-Tons of biomes and areas to explore
-Lots of unique enemies and items
-Tons of decorative blocks and furniture to suit all your building needs

CONS:
-Fighting mechanics could use improvement
-Block lag (blocks may take a second to appear after placing them)
-Steep difficulty curve
-Extreme item rarity (tourmaline)

Most of the cons are not horrible and will most likely be changed. Overall I think this game is superb, and it's free. So go ahead and give it a try for yourself!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For the 6 hours I played, non-stop mind you, I have to give this game a lot of credit. A friend bought this for me after telling me about it and I was a bit iffy on the idea of another sandbox game similar to Minecraft. But, there is a lot of differnces between the two games.

The structure of the game itself gives a whole new feel if you are use to playing Minecraft. It's not as easy as chop some wood, mine some stone, then you're good to go. There is a lot of depth to just the crafting alone. While it is still fairly easy to find all the resources you need, you need a lot of them. Even after you collect them, you might need to use some tools to break it down into a different matterial. (For example, breaking vines down into twine.) Yes, you have wait times on crafting stuff. While it isn't too terribly bad, the times do get a bit longer as you start using more advanced materials such as Obsidian, Iron, and Diamonds. But in my opinion, it adds more to the game because now you have to wait 5 minutes to advance and in that time, you could go out and collect more resources or even go spelunking.

The creatures in the game is definitely unique. While some do remind me of creatures from Jak and Daxter (the night Pigsy's and night Leafi's), they still have a unique vibe to them. And they of course vary in difficulty. While a few of them have unique skills such as blinding you for a short time or spinning to do a lot of damage, there isn't a lot to worry about as long as you keep some distance.

Also, there is furniture. And to be honest, it actually looks pretty nice. There is also a lot of ways to customize and build your own house and make it stand out from your friends. You have different types of carpet, walls, and even slanted roof planks you can craft. You even have different colored lamps. You could use them like my friend does and make each room different colors. Though the blue sometimes confuses me because I never know if it is dark out or not. But it still looks really nice. Much like a room with a bunch of black lights.

To add on to the crafting idea to the game, you do not start off with being able to craft everything in the game. You have to work your way up and find the recipes. While some of them are scattered in chests around the world, you usually unlock new ones after you craft something else. Like weapons for instance. After you craft a wood sword, you unlock the crafting recipe for a stone sword. Which means you have to work to find better things, meaning you actually have a goal to work towards.

While there is still some bugs in the game with it being early access, it still runs fairly smooth and it's easy to play with friends. No port forwarding or setting up custom servers. Simply create a world and set a password so your friends can join up. Even when you are offline, they can still join the world and continue which to me, is pretty awesome. I would gladly recommend this game to anyone who likes Minecraft or sandbox games in general. And I think if you actually take some time with this game, you'll find there is a lot of possibilites with it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I'm only a meager few hours into this game, and how do I feel about it?

This is my first review on steam, if that says anything.
People would be likely to compare this title to minecraft and for good reason-- but theres something different about Creativerse that I find much more appealing.

What I liked
The modern take on the art style provides an atmosphere I found myself enjoying.
My first world had me spawning in a forest, and the hollowed out logs and fallen leaves really gave it a nice feel while I took my first steps.

Everything seems to function well, and I like the way recipies are unlocked and stored in a crafting journal of sorts.
Movement is fluid and the hefty jump height feels good, but perhaps they could modify it in a way.. Allow players to release the key for a shorter jump rather than sailing full blast each time. All that extra air time can sometimes slow you down.

The array of Fauna & Flora that's already in game is impressive, and the way the critters are animated amuses me greatly.

What I didn't like
Combat, while feeling much better than a lot of games in it's genre, still feels a tad clunky. I find myself unable to dodge incoming blows the way I anticipated after reading the games features but-- I assume they intend to address this eventually. Maybe not.  I'd like to see some kind of parry or shields or some form of defensive feature like a roll to help improve your odds a bit.

Biomes looked great as a whole, but the transitions between them are a little straight forward. Beyond that, logging causes 'leaf clouds' to litter my landscape since im too lazy to get all of it. I feel the addition of a full tree felling or at least leaf desintergration should be added.

All in all.
A game with amazing potential. It doesnt use a free to play model thats unbalanced but purely cosmetic and if this is truly early access, I can only imagine what will come in its future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Its looks like minecraft, but it has its own particular style. The game has its own way of playing and is honestly a little tougher. The enemies are creative, but I found that the fighting them was fairly annoying due to the fact no matter how accurate you are, you dont always hit them, and they will always hit you when your close. There is a ridiculous amount of things you can use to build, and even has its own system where it shows you how to build a particular building. The teleporters are extremely useful, there will be no losing your home with them. I really wish they would add a map so I could actually navigate a little better.

Overall, its on par with minecraft, and is its own game with a ton of additions and differences that seperate it from minecraft. Of course, things are bound to change, so it could go anywhere from here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I played Minecraft for a long time, and during that time, I gave up playing on servers due to bugs, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ players, and plugins that make it generally not fun(donate $5.00 to be able to place water OKAY). On top of that, the only way I could ever have fun was by downloading mods which took way too long and sometimes they didn't even work.

Creativerse is different, it still has the same feel from when I first played minecraft and then some. The enemies are strange and unique. The landscape is blocky and still looks gorgeous. The music is interesting to listen to. And, I don't have to constantly worry about some green, walking human sized phallus walking over to me and blowing my house to kingdom come! It's still a bit glitchy, but it's early access. What can you do?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Keep in mind that I only have a few hours into the game as I'm writing this, and that the game is in Early Access.

+ Fluent Combat(compared to many other voxel games)
+ Graphics are gorgeous(compared to many other voxel games)
+ Good Soundtrack
+ Nice Tiering system, gives the feeling you are actually progressing
+ Lots and LOTS of stuff to play around with(and it seems there is much more to come)
+ Seems there is a lot to do and discover

- Crafting items is smashed all over the place(First you need to craft something in your Q menu, then you have to use machine A to craft piece B, and then you have to combine it with Piece C that has been created in machine X... you get my point. It's rather overwhelming, and quite time consuming)
- Interface needs improvement(As for now, you have to browse huge lists just to find that one thing you want to make. And the further you go, the bigger the lists become. Seriously needs a few QoL improvements there)
- Monster AI is quite derpy, sometimes ignoring people completely
- Once you got your basic set, the game isn't very challenging anymore(unlike items, it doesn't feel there are different many tiers of monsters out there(... yet?))
- Standard occasional bugs(no major crashing yet, just a few silly bugs like being stuck in the ceiling after jumping on the bed x.x)(+ you can jump on the bed)
- FPS drops a little when venturing underground(Nothing major, but slower comps might notice it)

As it is now, It's the typical Early Access game. It's playable, it's enjoyable, and it has great potential. There has been a lot of thought put into the game, and I appreciate it. The game isn't there yet, hence the EA status. It's up to the devs whether this game will become a master piece, or another could-have-been-awesome.

I will update my review if it turns out to be the latter, but until then, download and give it a try!

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

I only have a few hours into the game thus far, but already it has impressed me. There will be a lot of people compare this to Minecraft, and thats fine, cause when it comes down to it, its the exact same principle, only done much better with already far more building materials. And its still being added to, hence that its still in Early Access. My only problem so far is the games tends to have severe FPS drops and my machine is no slouch. Though I've read that many are seeing this as well. But hey, its still in development, so I can forgive for that. If you played Minecraft, or games like it, and you enjoyed them, then give this a go. Heck, even if you never played a game like this before, give it a go. I mean, what do have to lose, its free!

I will update this after I've played the game a bit more and after a couple more updates to the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was pleasantly surprised when I started playing. I was genuinely not expecting a good experience due to past bad lucks with free-to-play-minecraftish-sandbox of the style, but Creativerse stunned me by being IT'S OWN GAME, and not just a mincecraft clone. Despite the lack of blocking during combat, and the need of more variation in biomes and monsters (simply have two or three models for each monsters with texture variants would help.), the principle behind it all is amazingly well executed.

Up to now, one of the most robust early access indie games I've got to play in a long time.

EDIT:
While I still give this a thumbs up, the lack of frequent and robust updates drove me off. Once you hit the end-game content, there isn't much left to do other than to build whatever you'd like.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I went into this not sure if I was going to like the game, but willing to give it a little bit of time to see for myself.  After the first few hours of playtime, I realised that I was hooked.  My family and I have always loved playing minecraft together and this is everything we loved about that game and then some.  We can create, we can fight, we can BLOW THINGS UP!  It allows each of us to play in our own style.  The amazing part is that this is still being tweaked and improved upon to add even more incredible things.  There are only two things that I can see on the negative side so far and those are:
1. There is no offline gameplay
2.  Characters are not modable (but you do get  a choice between being a boy or a girl)
The fact that these are the only things that I and my family can find that are negative, says a lot.  In the future, these things could also change.  We will be playing this game for a long time to come so hopefully we will see it come about.  I would recommend this game to anyone and everyone!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I held off trying this game for a while, because I thought it was just another crappy minecraft knockoff. I had no desire to play it until my friend finally convinced me to, and I'm glad I did try it.

Despite the looks, this game really has nothing in common with Minecraft besides the blocky graphics, which is a common look in many games nowadays. In every other aspect this game has more similarities with Trove and Terraria, and is really fun to play. The game is simple, but it challenges you, and you won't want to stop playing it.

The main issue with this game, is that the population of creatures trying to kill you is far too high and you do less damage than them, and essentially are weaker than them, which isn't so much of a bad thing, but since advancing in the game requires killing a lot of the same animals over and over again, it sometimes feels a bit repetitive. In this way, it is much like Trove.

Overall, it's a fine game and I would certainly recommend it to anyone who was considering giving it a shot.

I only have a few hours into the game thus far, but already it has impressed me. There will be a lot of people compare this to Minecraft, and thats fine, cause when it comes down to it, its the exact same principle, only done much better with already far more building materials. Though I've read that many are seeing this as well. But hey, its still in development, so I can forgive for that. If you played Minecraft, or games like it, and you enjoyed them, then give this a go. Heck, even if you never played a game like this before, give it a go. I mean, what do have to lose, its free!

I will update this after I've played the game a bit more and after a couple more updates to the game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is pretty awesome!  It is just like minecraft but with better graphics.  I have never played minecraft because I don\'t want to pay $10 out right for lame graphics, so I can\'t say what gameplay it has that is different but it is the same idea.  The developers are great.  The game has micro transaction but not for everything, in fact since I have started playing they made some things which cost money free.  You can still use coins to buy stuff but the blueprints can now be bought with mats.  That is a nice feature.  I don\'t mind giving a company my money in micro transactions but most games make it impossible to get items without paying.  Not only that but what you do pay for is a good price.  Even without paying for anything there is still tons to explore and build in this game.  The ability to create a pvp or non pvp world is great too.  You can create a world where you and your friends can just build and not have to worry about any danger.  Great for artists as well!  I have seen some amazing works of art built out of blocks.  All in all it is a great game.  Fight, explore,  and build.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I applaud anyone trying to do what Minecraft does only differently -- Minecraft is far from perfect, and at this point Mojang/Microsoft has made so much money off the status quo that it is unlikely we are going to see great strides in the genre from them.  We need developers willing to retread the same ground and try different paths if we are going to see better games in the genre.

But that being said, Minecraft is very, very good.  The bar can be vaulted, but it is set high.  And Creativerse makes some very basic errors in its early game that are going to relegate it to the dustbin of time if they are not fixed.  I don't usually write first-person experience" reviews
date: but I think this will speak to fans of the genre.\n\nFirst thing I noticed is that even the starter recipes require many types of raw materials.  Forget about processed materials -- even turning wood into planks requires a device I would call "second tier."  I was fortunate
recommended:
I had spawned into a region that was resource rich.  I can't imagine trying to play this game after spawning into an unfriendly biome (assuming they exist -- maybe you always spawn into dense forest?).  After some gathering I crafted up a wooden sword (three raw materials) and a wood power cell (four raw materials; used for mining stone) and struck out to find a cliff to dig a shelter into.

What I discovered next was that the stone layer is extremely thin.  Maybe ten blocks from dirt to "bedrock" which required a stone power cell (five raw materials) to mine.  A stone power cell requires coal.  I wasn't lucky enough to find coal in the vicinity of my shelter so I made some more moss torches and went looking for a nearby cave.

Upon finding one I discovered that while a moss torch is sufficient to light a 3x3x3 room
hoursPlayed: it really only has a functional radius of 2 blocks out in the open.  That's not a lot of light.  I should have known
voteText: considering they only required two separate raw materials to manufacture.  Still
helpfulPercent: I figured there had to be a lot of coal not far beneath the surface and descended.\n\nI could hear a monster
votesHelpful: but I cowboyed up and kept going anyway.  I was still in the dirt layer
votesTotal:
and was confident I wasn't deep enough to encounter anything truly dangerous.

Boy was I wrong.

Something green and  vaguely bipedal with about a dozen eyes surged up out of the darkness right in front of my face.  I defended myself with my wooden sword
votesFunny: and managed to get in about 20 good hits before it did me in with its blinding flashbulb and slam attacks.  That was it for me.  I quit to menu and exited the game.\n\nI don't want to be unfair -- I realize this game is free
commentsCount: and in early access besides -- but the incredibly high production quality throughout suggests that the developer is not an amateur
column16: and yet the game balance leaves a lot to be desired.\n\nThe crafting system in this game is very complicated and interdependent
column17: and therefore early game success feels like it is dependent more on luck than it should be.  To get A I need B
column18: but if B isn't readily available I need C to go looking for it and C requires A.  That's a tough pill to swallow.\n\nIt is nice that the game abandons Minecraft's crafting grid -- while a clever way to get more mileage out of fewer materials
column19: the grid can be very tedious and is ultimately unnecessary
column20: as both the XBox Live and Pocket editions of the game have shown.  All things considered
column22: I'm not sure the dozen kinds of raw materials required for first tier crafting in Creativerse is really a viable alternative.\n\nCombat is my least favorite part of any survival game -- I feel like most of them are better without it.  But even considering my bias
column23: an enemy I can encounter during the day in the dirt layer should not require more than 20 hits with a crafted weapon to defeat!\n\nSo
column27: despite its price and despite its early access status.  I hope to see it improve
column28: but right now the early game does not inspire confidence enough to warrant toughing it out to see the late game.\n\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dear Consumers, Avid Gamers, and Concerned Passerby's
It makes me sad to read all the negitive reviews on this game, it almost kept me from getting it to be honest. After playing this game for 11 hours straight I can honestly say that although aesthetically similiar to minecraft, with alot of the same gameplay elements as minecraft. It is not minecraft at all. In the time up untill writing this review I have made a multilevel portal system using the built in nameable portals, created a chest based item sorting system using the nameable chests, created a medieval thatched cottage with a sloped roof(screw you minecraft stairs) and went to the depths of hell in search of precious metals while avoiding evil pigs, anglerfish, and other pokemon-esque monsters. True it is like minecraft in some ways but that is what makes this game truely awesome. It takes elements from a good game and goes a step up and kind of to the side. Minecraft was not the first of its kind, it helped make the genre popular sure, but this could be the next step in the evolution.

Some points to note:

-Being in early access means things can change
-Your paying for early access, a chance to play it before it goes free to play for everyone
-It has few bugs, but being in alpha it has to be expected
-It has great Mechanics so far
-A butt load of content(11 hours in and still so much I havent seen)
-Runs so smooth, over 60 fps on the highest settings
-memorable gameplay
-Fun respawn mechanic (via a telepad that you can relocate any number of times)
-TELEPADS! You can teleport to your friends, they can teleport to you and it doesnt ever feel like your cheating.
Cons: (Not included things that go along with any alpha)
-No mounts yet (have already been hinted at though)
-Besides combat, few survival elements, e.i. no hunger or thirst system
-Slight learning curve(Although very satisfying when you do figure things out)
-lack of explosion noises(Tnt makes tiny boom)
Otherwise I personally love this game as it stands now. I also give it 10/10

Edit: Now with many more hours under my belt I am happy to report that this game is very little like minecraft. I ran into what I would equate to the Nether in minecraft, I found that I could dig deeper still. Let me tell you, there are places and things down in the depths minecraft would have nightmares about ;) still loving it 10/10
If you guys have positive or negitive experiences you want to share to add to this review I really want to hear them.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before you say or think anything, NO THIS IS NOT A MINECRAFT CLONE. It is a voxel (or box) style game.  Minecraft is not the only voxel game in the world.  This game however, was worth paying the $20 to get to play it early.

What I like about it:
- There's a back story, in which you find through items scattered in the world
- The crafting system
- Building creativity / freedom
- Active community (dev.s listen and reply very quickly to suggestions!)
- Friendly community
- No pressure to buy anything
- The creatures are downright adorable
- and more.

I highly recommend that anyone who loves adventure to play this game.  Even if you don't have the imagination for sandbox games, this one has you exploring the world in your own way.  Craft all the items.  Find recipes that aren't just handed to you.  Create your base.  Blow everything up! (Even friends)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It seemed fine at the beginning but then I saw coins. This game doesn't have much Pay-To-Win features. However, you can use coins to buy blueprints, block skins and zones in the map. I am fine with the block skins, paying for a coloured block is fine. However, blueprints and zones are a whole other matter. While there aren't any blueprints in the shop on sale, there is a potential for game advantage and I hate that. The zones claim ownership of certain locations preventing other from using it. For the coins, the best price I saw was $55.71 for 5000 coins. It's true what they say. The most expensive games on Steam are the free ones. Thus, I am sad to have to thumb this down.

PROS
1. Like Minecraft
There is no clear objective. Just play and build.

2. Skin Business Model
Selling shiny block skins is fair to me.

CONS
1. Pay To Win
Despite a Minecraft game having nothing to win, the idea that people can get special blueprints and zones with coins irks me. The blue prints.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I haven't delved too deep (YET) into Creativerse, but what time I've spent in it (a few months ago as of this review, I'm sure there's all sorts of new stuff!) has been quite fun. Sure, it's another Minecraft type game, but so what? That's a good thing. The way things function however, make the game play quite different than minecraft even early on, and from what I could tell it was only going to get more divergent on its own path.

One thing I can tell up front is this is more of an exploration based/combat game in terms of your delving down below ground. Sure, there are critters in minecraft, but no one really worries about any of the minecraft creatures. This game has things that will EAT YOU AND SPIT OUT YOUR EYES TO MAKE SOUP FOR LEFTOVERS ON THURSDAY.

Anyways, I strongly recommend this game if you like building/open world/exploration minecraft type games, enough that I suggest you pay for it despite it eventually going free to play upon release. Support the devs for their quality, hard work, and have fun building and exploring!

Obviously a minecraft clone. Has some minor glitches here and there, nothing severe.
Haven't played minecraft in a while, but Creativerse seems to make some smart adjustments that make the game more approachable and fun: ingame recipes and easy teleporting to your home or that of other players.
It's also for free, you can purchase some cosmetic blocks or blue-prints for bigger structures (which you really don't need if you prefer to design your home by yourself).

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI've only played for about an hour so far, but this game seems much more polished in the presentation than Minecraft ever was. They do a lot of subtle things that help the world feel more believable while still keeping the same blocky building construction that worked so well in Minecraft. I haven't tried multiplayer yet, but it appears from the menus that you will be easily able to join others' worlds. Also, each player has a teleporter built in making it easy to construct a base that you can return to. I recommend trying this when it's free to play at least, though it was totally worth my money to get early access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good game.  4/5 Would recommend buying the finished product when released, but even for early access the game has a lot of content.  I put quite a bit of time into it, could have spent more building, but I'm not really a building guy, I prefer exploration, fighting etc.  If you enjoyed Minecraft, thisr is an improvement.


What I liked:
-Graphics are nice, good lighting effects. I found myself stopping and looking around quite a bit.

-Lots of the biomes are really neat, the swamp especially I enjoyed when I first discovered it.
Canyons are also very cool.

-Recipie discoveries - I liked that it was tiered so that was really good.  I didn't like that I had to build some stuff to open the other stuff though, was kind of a waste of resources, but whatever.

-Difficulty - Tier by tier the monsters where pretty tough, so whenever I went into combat I was really careful because ya never know what was going to happen.  As I got better weapons the stuff above ground was pretty much cake, but down underground there was never a time when I felt comfortable or secure.





What I didn't like:
-You don't know what you don't know.  I'm still not sure how to get some of the items required to make some stuff.  I never saw an Egg the entire game.  I'm guessing you have to Tame something?

- Some of the items required to make stuff was tedious to gather, especially potions at times.  The resistance potions where kind of annoying to make.  Not a huge deal, but maybe get a bit more for less resources?

- Farming with the Hoe - This was way to slow.. I don't know if there was any other kind of item that made it faster, but tilling the grass/ground was 4 or 5 seconds per plot... it was time consuming.

-Corruption mob density was a little high.  Because they had so many HP it was really tedious to fight because you got swarmed.  I was building terrain traps to farm stuff, I'm cool with that but it gets tedius when you want to explore but can't.


Suggestions:
-Combat - I liked combat, it was challenging.  I felt maybe a medium power range weapon would be a good choice, something to soften mobs up before engaging?  I know there's bombs, but they are somewhat expensive to make.

-Crafting Tabs - Let me tab off stuff if I like, as per ARK.

-Gathering Water/Liquid was kind of annoying.  I felt that if I sat there, it should maybe speed way up as I collect the resource?

-Terraria, rare monster drops to summon bosses, etc.


Anyhow, good game.
Free week was awesome, I'll buy the game for sure when it's out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

friends recommended this to me even when i'm already busy with some other builder games, ended up x6 times more hours played than all of them totalled.
+simple and fun
+Environment develops slowly around you
+cool different biomes with more new blocks to discover
+underground-content filled
+low spec requirement and small file size download
+your best place to show your creativity in building
+co-op
-p2p exclusive blocks
-Early Access glitches you may expect
-very simple combat mechanism
-crafting lists are still increasing, currently not a lot. (3/4/2015)
-no adventurous story gaming
-strict & tight community vs toxic community exists (i think dota 2 is 'lightly' better.... no i'm not joking lol...)

it has its own art, gr9 music, items and potentially immersive, would definitely recommend this as a co-op building exploration game to many friends. Its still in early access so don't expect much to spend your time long on.

8/10 would definitely lose other friends for this game again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Aside from being a Sandbox Voxel game like minecraft, it has it's own charms and seperates itself pretty well. I like the direction it is going and hope it continues to stay different than minecraft.

What I notably like is:
The crafting system - really interesting, makes me want to unlock all the recipes

Different biomes - refreshing and interesting types of biomes even based off of seasons makes me want to explore around and see what I can find.

Fear of caves - don't dig straight down...

Creatures - not the generic cow and chicken combos i mean there are chickens but they are more cocktrice like and more interesting than just a normal mooing cow, plus the night creatures look scary :D at least you can see them most of the time ^^
---------------------------------
What I find so - so

-The fighting is lacking, kinda makes me feel like it's turn based like when I am not even close enough or behind it I still get hit by attacks while i try to maneuver and evade it.

-Food is rare, so is health regen

-Could add some more filler content or more visible goals. I know it's there but, as someone who started out some of the things are a bit hard to find and some items aren't readily accessable which drags the crafting system back when you don't have the proper item or tools.

But I do recommend it for people who enjoy Voxels and want something new and refreshing, maybe more for people who want to relax a bit. Not recommended for those who are hardcore or looking to 'conquer' land because it is actually a fairly relaxing game from what I can tell on the surface of the game itself and it's gameplay. I do look forward to see how it develops more!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This seems like a genuine and driven attempt to improve on the MInecraft concept. Crafting is fun and streamlined. You can teleport to your base! Combat is simple and satisfying.  I rarely feel like I can't quickly find what I need. The world itself is pleasing to look at. It does feel a little unfinished, and the most unfinished-feeling thing seems to be the boring character models that lack expression or appearance options. Aside from that, I can't seem to conjure any serious complaints. It lacks many of the frustrating elements Minecraft presented us with, and the overall experience is quite pleasant.

This might just be my stupid laptop, but sometimes the framerates drop unexpectedly and won't return to normal until I restart the game. It's manageable, but annoying. Hopefully they'll buff that out.

I am enthusiastic and on-board with this. It almost creeps me out that it's free to play. I sure hope it gets finished!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly I struggled to decide if the game was worth recommending or not. This game is 90-95% a minecraft clone. With that said, it's not a bad clone, in fact it improves on a few things over minecraft, it's combat has more satisfaction to it, though it is still VERY simple and nothing but an exchange of blows till one or the other dies. The graphics are a bit nicer, with much improved shadows and lighting over minecraft's godawful shadows, and the textures are better too.

The only major downside is that the game lacks content, and more importantly difficult" content. In 13 hours I had built a massive carved limestone mansion
recommended: killed every creature in the game
hoursPlayed: explored every biome
voteText: and aquired the best equipment that exists. I had done everything that was worth doing. (And even a few that weren't.) And I did ALL of this
helpfulPercent: without dying
votesHelpful: not even once
votesTotal: hell I didn't even drop below half health I think.\n\nTo sum this up
votesFunny: it's a minecraft clone with better graphics
commentsCount: a few improvements
column16: much less content
column17: and "FAR" easier gameplay. Why did I recommend it then? It's genuinely free to play. The game does have a cash shop
column18: but I didn't see anything in it that either imbalanced the game
column19: nor that I found even remotely interesting or worth buying. And a totally free game that I didn't instantly delete off my harddrive by itself makes it a recommended game."
column20: January 12

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR: Good game, a bit like minecraft but with better graphics (That means it kinda lags on decent or worse PCs). Everyone should at least try it, anyway its free.

ACTUAL REVIEW:
It's a fun game. If you like Minecraft there are 2 ways this can go.
1. You will call this a copy of Minecraft and hate it.
2. You can spot the things that make it good and enjoy it.

I am rating it 6/10 ( It's still early access that means it will become better )

And Here are some Pros and Cons from my experience so far.

DISCLAIMER: I ONLY PLAYED SINGLEPLAYER FOR 70 MINS.

-Pros-
-ITS FREE
-It's beatiful and cute
-Some monsters are a bit creepy
-Overall good models (except main character. I didnt really like it because it seemed really childish but thats my opinion only)
-A huge variety of items even though its only early access
-Huge world with a lot of things to discover
-The teleporter (Well, its a bit cheaty but who cares?)
-SUPER JUMP. I mean who doesn't love it?
(That's only some of the things. I dont really wanna waste your time or take away the feeling of exploration)

-Cons-
-I have a decent PC and it kinda lags on the lowest (Fastest) graphics.
-Sometimes it seems like a minecraft rip-off
-Unavoidable enemy hits. You cant juke the hits of enemies and taming them is sometimes impossible (There must be a way but I didnt discover it)
-It's easy to find your items after death. That way it's not that challenging. Actually you can set the teleporter when you are about to die and get the items when you respawn.
-Tamed animals didnt really fight for me and that seemed kinda odd (Probably I did something wrong)
-Some items are hard to find and there is only a little in-game help to find them.
-And the worst of all: Every gamers most hated enemy. F***ing microtransaction. But i guess its free it balances the pain a bit. :P

That's all for now. Sorry if I made mistakes. I only played for 70 mins so I didn't really explore the whole place.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay... Although i've only played for like 60+ hours, but i guess it's enough for me to finally make a review, since i've reached the deepest floor on  creativerse, and i kinda get the hang of the whole game. And this is my score for this game ( Please keep in mind that i have never played minecraft so i can't compare the 2 game) :
Gameplay : 8.5
Music : 8
Crafting : 8.5
Combat : 8 ( The combat is simple but the monsters and their unique spawn rate is unique )
Unique : 8.5
Longevity : 9! ( If you play this with friends!)

IMPORTANT MESSAGE ON THE BOTTOM OF THE REVIEW! SO PLEASE DO READ THE REVIEW THOROUGHLY :)))

A bit of my story about the game :
For someone who has never played minecraft and stuff... For me this game is amazing,
This game has endless possibilities, I can do almost anything that i want in this game... The graphics is awesome, the gameplay is good on its on way, There are tons of unique monsters.

The first time i played this game... I was confused, because i have never played minecraft before, and there is barely any Tutorial for this game, but after playing a few hours, I'm starting to get the hang of the game and i really enjoyed it.
I was playing with my buddy and at first we were building a small treehouse and stuff, and we thought that it was amazing... But then after a few days, we explored that this game has ( What we called it ):
1. Spring Zone
2. Summer Zone
3. Autumn Zone
4. Winter Zone

And after we look around, we decided to move our house to the Winterrrr Zoneeeeee....!!!
And then we build our own castle, WE DESTROYED THE WHOLE MOUNTAINNNN WITH A ♥♥♥♥IN BOMB LOLOL.... It was amazing xD... And we made our own monster breeding place, using the soil and the ecosystem based on where they spawn. so we basically dont have to walk to actually farm for the monsters.

OKAY BACK TO THE REVIEW!

~~~~~GAMEPLAY :
The gameplay for me is unique, simple , and fun ... It doesn't require you that much of skill to actually enjoy the whole game... And as someone who has never played a single sandbox, voxel based open world game.... this game is amazing, because i can actually do almost anything that i want. And the features in this game varies, and it never bores me.
- You can suck the ground and mine the ore based on what layer of soil you are in... There are :
------- 1. Normal Soil
------- 2. Layers with Obsidian and a few useful ores
------- 3. Layers with iron and a few useful ores
------- 4. Layers with Mythril and a few useful ores
------- 5. Layers with Diamond and a few useful ores
------- 6. LAVA LAYERZZZZ
------- 7. End of the world (?) Where you can gather Lumite...
ANDDD... each layers has its own unique monsters with unique drop for crafting!
Best way to open the space for mining is using BOMBS!!! easy space lol.

Watch this guide : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=olRGrgYsV-o

MUSICCC : The music is quite soothing and it's really enjoyable while playing the game ...

Crafting : The crafting is quite basic, as usual... you gather stuffs and when you have enough ingredient , fuala~ you can craft those items...
BUT... If you want to open the next recipe , you basically have to AT LEAST craft the recipe before it... Once
So basically if you want to open the whole recipe, just craft em all... although not all recipe has the next recipe if you craft 'em
AND WHAT MAKES IT UNIQUE :
There are different processing machine for each kinds of crafting, and it's what makes the game quite unique, and you can multitask different craft in a different machine! and you can also make unlimited amount of that machine too! amazing right...?!

COMBATTT :
The combat itself is quite simple, just mash-click your button lol... But what makes it unique is the kinds of monsters and items that they dropped
AAAANNDD Where they spawn! you can actually make an ecosystem just like where they used to live, and the monster itself will spawn! That way, you dont have to actually run from side to side just to gather those monsters item, since this game has limited amount of teleport machine, which is limited to one teleport machine for each players.

UNIQUEEE :
This is game TO me is unique, because you can do almost anything, and it really differs from other sandbox game that i've witnessed from youtube and stuff... The gameplay and etc is much more polished than the ancestor... Minecraft, although there are some parts that still lacks of something...
But overall this game is fun, enjoyable, unique, and if you play this with your friends, this game is just amazingly fun in its own way lol trust me!

LONGEVITY :
The game is very fun, it doesnt get boring fast, and even after 200+hours i would even still play this game and smile like a dork everytime i finished building something with my buddies.
One key to make this game longlasting ... Play this game with your friends... seriously... it gets really fun especially if you play this game with teamspeak or any voicechat program...

SOOO This is the end of my review! I hope you enjoy reading my first...detailed review i have ever made.
I hope it makes it easier for you to decide to play this game or not...

AND IF YOU WANT TO JOIN MY WORLD ON CREATIVERSE... SIMPLY JUST ADD ME, AND CHAT ME WHEN IM ONLINE :)
MY WORLD IS STILL RATHER SMALL BUT I BASICALLY HAVE COVERED MOST OF THE IMPORTANT ASPECTS OF THE GAME SUCH AS ORE MINING, MONSTER BREEDING, AND A MOUNTAIN SIZED CASTLE :)

All in all though it's a lot of fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This seems like a genuine and driven attempt to improve on the MInecraft concept. Crafting is fun and streamlined. You can teleport to your base! Combat is simple and satisfying.  I rarely feel like I can't quickly find what I need. The world itself is pleasing to look at. It does feel a little unfinished, and the most unfinished-feeling thing seems to be the boring character models that lack expression or appearance options. Aside from that, I can't seem to conjure any serious complaints. It lacks many of the frustrating elements Minecraft presented us with, and the overall experience is quite pleasant.

This might just be my stupid laptop, but sometimes the framerates drop unexpectedly and won't return to normal until I restart the game. It's manageable, but annoying. Hopefully they'll buff that out.

I am enthusiastic and on-board with this. It almost creeps me out that it's free to play. I sure hope it gets finished!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After blowing up my friend's living room I have developed a worrying obsession with explosives...and in turn have learned to fear The Stick he uses to beat me whenever he finds my stash of explosives hidden in our house...I suppose that makes me a troll but I've always had the good grace to rebuild what I break, I'm not a total ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥...

That aside this game is fantastic, it offers an easy to learn but hard to master gameplay setting with plenty to do like crafting, mining, hunting, cooking, building, farming, taming and best of all, exploration. Playing with 3 friends is just perfect and we all did our own thing, here's how I would describe us.

PotatoGod: Tames any new animal he finds and enjoys beating me with sticks for killing his pets and blowing up our houses. Also likes to masquerade as my abusive father as he beats me. (Notable feature; broke the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ ocean with ice)

Piecast: Builds things, mines, gets bored of said project and just moves on leaving half built ruins and if it breaks he just gives up...Such as creating a hole in the ocean while attempting to be my under the sea neighbor.

Highlord90 (Me): Kills anything that moves, plays with explosives, wanders the world both above and underground and visits hell on a regular basis then decides to forsake company altogether, swims out to sea, and builds a house in the coral.

That One Guy: Decides to live in extreme climates and tames a Blizzard Chizzard which he dresses in a top hat and bow tie and calls him Donald Trump which is the most beautiful creature that has ever existed...Also broke the ocean with ice...

We've worked on 3 worlds already...

World One: I destroy 2 houses, one to see how bombs worked and the other to try and get rid of the glitched green goo which used to be my bed. We move on after our house becomes a crater...

World Two: We rebuild the old house and live in it comfortably. I ask Potato God to tame 4 pigs for a farm and he comes back with 3 undead pig skeletons and a corrupted pig which he names Optimus Prime, Bony Butt, Skeletor and Dr. Evil. I start a huge farm with real Pigs and eventually move to live in the ocean but delete the world when my friends troll me and break my house...

World Three: Currently being used, building the tree house blueprint...

So yes this game is random, it can be funny, you will enjoy it alone but more with friends. 40 hours in and I'm still doing new things so get this free gem and just enjoy yourself, have fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dig Dig Dig.

It almost seems as if this entire game is based off digging. Sure, after hours of digging through dirt, rock, and siltstone you'll find some mysterious caverns and some monsters to kill. Play this on a late night while wearing headphones and it'll scare ye' more than a few times. Dig a lil' further and you'll find diamond and lava. Hooray.

As some point you'll realize that there is just not enough content, let alone a goal to reach for. Of course, building a house, office building, tower, or whatever comes to mind, is pretty amusing...until you realize that no one but you will actually see it. With everyone creating their own world there is no chance of interaction between other players. Oh how I wish there was just one gigantic world....

As for item creation, the list is somewhat bleak. It starts off with an alchemy-type process in which you need to find resources to unlocks a few items to create. Exciting. Later (but not much later) it ends with creating swords to create other swords and doors to unlock other doors....same with grenades... In otherwords, the list is unorthodox and has no definite clear order while ignoring the gigantic gaps between items. The game could accomplish much more with many more useful resources, which then could easily extend the item construction list.

What it needs for me to come back: More extractable resources, one world for all, extended item list, bigger monsters to slay.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A lot of you will compare this game to Minecraft, so let me tell you a few things:
1. It's not Minecraft.
2. It's FREE.
3. It's still in early alpha, so it will get even better.
If those three reasons aren't enough for you to try this game, then you can stop reading and ignore this review.

The graphics (texture detail) are really good. When I've tried Minecraft a couple of times before I always got a headache after a few hours, because of all the pixelated stuff going on there. It was hard to see and it was hard on the eyes. Even with mods that used 2x more detailed textures. This game is still a block/voxel based sandbox, but it's the first one that actually looks good. There are a lot of materials and resources, way more than your usual sandbox game. The crafting system is really cool and unique.

The game is awesome. If you like sandbox games you should definitely buy this one... Oh wait, it's FREE!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I played during the free week and decided not to buy the game simply because it will eventually be F2P with an in-game store.  Right now, it costs money to play as a way to help fund the developers during Early Access.  It's already in a playable state with a lot of content, but it will get a lot better from the looks of things.  I recommend this game as a future endeavor and hope you will check it out when it's done.

Creativerse is a Minecraft-inspired building block game with very similar gameplay mechanics but also vastly superior graphics and input support.  It is already a very stable game build with a lot of content to keep you busy.  The in-game store also looks promising with some unique recipes, redeemable codes, daily free coins, and building blueprints.  I also enjoyed the game's crafting system and unique monster designs.  It also helps that the world is not entirely voxel-based and has beautiful art.  I look forward to future content but will wait for the game to go free-to-play so I can play the full experience.

-Grabbing materials feels like using the force.
-Teleportation pad, good for when getting lost out in the world.

Cons:
-Some basic materials are hard to get.
-Ugly

Don't go in thinking you can craft something in your inventory, this isn't minecraft.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an easy to learn building/exploration type game. And any similarities to other titels such as minecraft, rust, terr-.. THEY are all mearly happenstances:) The games greatest virtue is the strait forward and easy multiplayer setup. You just click multiplayer, write name and password, and then all your friends can join easily. You become the admin, but the searver is hosted by the game creaters, so any pc can host. Especially joining through steam is perfected. Additionaly the game has recipies for everything, and these recepies are displayed clearly and smoothly. While also not cluttering the screen. Recipies are learned many different ways, by killing, looting, exploring or in case of the most esecial recipies; by creating the item one matirial tier further down, or in case of multiplayer, by having it in your inventory.(inc. someone else made it) The game is artisticly beutiful, especially the mobs are highly uniqe, original and interesting. The only lacking part of this game is an option menue inside the main menue. Having to host a personal world if order to create a EU character before joining a friends EU server. And finally: The lack of content. 4 friends all working together and rushing finishing the game, not bothering to gather extra rescourses or building more than a big shack. Can finish the game in 8 hours. 8 well spent hours.

My advice, pick it for a LAN, host a server, get everyone on, and then GET the best extracter in the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When I first saw this game, I expected a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ Minecraft clone with endless microtransactions.  But it was free, and I saw no reason not to try it.

After fourty hours in the span of about half a month, here I am. It does have microtransactions, but nothing you need  to survive (I spent the gold they gave me on a treehouse, lmao). And it's far from a minecraft clone.

It operates on the same premise- Mine blocks and gather resources to expand your territory and better fight the creatures that come in the night. After that, though, it's got it's own really interesting spin- one that takes it to a new level.

Gameplay:
Like I said, the premise is like Minecraft's. Mine blocks, defend yourself from hostile creatures, and expand your world. However, it's got its own system. You have a mining cell, fit onto your wrist to gather and hold pieces of the world around you. And you can craft anything, anywhere, with no crafting bench. So long as you have one somewhere and you've gotten the refined materials for it. To make food, you get a cooking station as well. And you forge ores at a, well at a forge.

Your ores are much the same way. you upgrade said mining cells to dig deeper into the earth and gather more precious materials from nodes. However, to do this, you need extractors (and time). You attach it to a node, then it will break it down for you. At this point, it's gone, and you're left with everything you need to keep grinding your way down.

But the deeper you go, the more dangerous things get. The enemies get tougher and more vicious, and there are more dangers, lava, and after a while, even just being that deep starts to take a toll. You'll have a meter filling up, and when it's full, you'll take damage. Cute and fuzzy the creatures of the world may look, they can be bloodthirsty as all hell.

But that's what makes it really fun, the challenge. 10/10 would get mauled by adorable lizards again.

Story:
There's not much of one, really. Someone left you out in the middle of nowhere to survive (or not) on your own. And through various journal scraps, you find out more about someone (or maybe multiple someones) who've been there before you through journal pages. Now, I love a good story. But I also love the freedom to make one up myself through bits and pieces. So for me, this one gets 7/10, would read way too much into random journal scraps again.

Overall:
The game's simple to get into, the learning curve is tough, but not brutal, and it's addictive. Between expanding your base(s) and exploring what the world has to offer, you could lose a whole night playing this without even realizing. Having to wait a long time for some of the materials is a slight pain in the ♥♥♥♥, but it's nothing that would ruin the game.

Easily a 9/10. I'd recommend this to anyone, at least to try out. After all, it's free, so there's nothing to lose (but time), and a really great new game to gain!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I played during the free week and decided not to buy the game simply because it will eventually be F2P with an in-game store.  Right now, it costs money to play as a way to help fund the developers during Early Access.  It's already in a playable state with a lot of content, but it will get a lot better from the looks of things.  I recommend this game as a future endeavor and hope you will check it out when it's done.

Creativerse is a Minecraft-inspired building block game with very similar gameplay mechanics but also vastly superior graphics and input support.  It is already a very stable game build with a lot of content to keep you busy.  The in-game store also looks promising with some unique recipes, redeemable codes, daily free coins, and building blueprints.  I also enjoyed the game's crafting system and unique monster designs.  It also helps that the world is not entirely voxel-based and has beautiful art.  I look forward to future content but will wait for the game to go free-to-play so I can play the full experience.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A lovely game to fill in that Minecraft-shaped void in your heart!
Creativerse has no greater objective and no major bosses to find. You simply exist to create and mine things as you please! It is in general very soothing to play (unless you're digging in the deepest layer, which is kinda dark) and, best of all, free! (Game is funded by optional microtransactions for special blocks and blueprints to make structures.)


PROS:

- Tons of blocks to decorate and build.

- Different layers and biomes to explore.

- Great graphics! sunshafts and high res textures.

- Teleporting, so you don't have to walk back to places if you've built the teleporter.

- Hotkeys can be changed!

- Graphics can be lowered!

- You can tame animals; farm them or just have them follow you around.

- Great soundtrack!

- Easy multiplayer! You can even keep it private by adding a password.

- Friendly for people of all ages to play; very forgiving upon death.

- the ability to claim chunks of land, lock chests/furnaces/extractors, and so on.

- Rotate blocks with the 'R' key!

-------

EHH

- Sometimes light sources glitch out and do not provide light; digging up blocks nearby fixes it, but it can get rather annoying, especially in the dark.

- Pets set to follow do so very closely; they do NOT help in combat.

- requires Wifi to play.

- Lots of block variety can cause inventory to become very messy.

-------

Overall, very nice! Worth a shot to anyone looking for a block-y game or just wanting to kill time.
